name: Verified User in Construction
title: Control your own information destiny
answers:
Vena has been such a positive in our world! After an exhaustive search, we decided that Vena was the system for ACME for financial reporting needs.

Within the first week of using the system we had 3 years of information loaded, consolidations performed and financial statements written.  

The initial training was fantastic (we were lucky enough to get a good partner who gave me one-on-one training) so I was in control of the education. I realize that not everyone can get this kind of customized training, but it was worth it. I "drove" the process and the consultant corrected and helped me along during the process.

After we were on our own, we extended the processes to include budgeting and forecasting which has made analysis so quick and useful during changing times.

We are working with our ERP to get auto-transmission of data into the system but until we are able to get that working, we can mimic this process by manually loading the transactions from our system(s) so month end analysis on the detailed transactions are available on a consolidated basis. This has proved beneficial to parce out actual detail and give the responsible parties for analysis. Once we finally have an auto feed it will be a seamless process to any end user (only quicker).

Because Vena is more than a financial reporting software we are currently starting to use it for other database information. Tracking our PPE inventory, looking at metrics and historical information. Currently, we're running this information in excel and it's so much that it's bogging down our spreadsheets. Having refresh-able information at our fingertips is easing the stress.

Very little to dislike! I would like to see expanded training on the training website for more than the basics. (Calc's, setting up process flows, etc.) Since they've been adding new things quite often, i'm sure it's in the queue to be done.
Consolidation of information. 1 place to look at the data instead of multiple systems (we have multiple ERP's here.) Achieving quality financial statements quickly has been our #1 benefit.
Don't hesitate to look at Vena. For any excel users, this is a welcomed software addition.

name: George T.
title: Learning Curve
answers:
Operating as an extension of Excel, Vena has both extensive flexibility for design and implementation along with the familiarity of using an existing product rather than learning an entirely new system. 

Support and customer service reps are very keen and quick to assist.
By having a single template used across many users and projects, you can instantaneously roll out new features to your entire team.
Loading time on complex templates can be time consuming. Some mapping/design features could use a refresh to be faster or friendlier.

We consolidate 10-20 companies into a single entity for reporting purposes on a monthly basis. Originally this process took several senior employees a month and was only done annually, now one of our intermediate accountants can perform all the required tasks in under a week.

In addition, we have streamlined our cost reporting system on a number of productions and have been working towards budgeting and projections systems. 

Throughout all such tasks we have improved data flows between users and trimmed out an enormous amount of previously tedious work on manually updating and copying between documents. Powerful and Flexible with a bit of a

Give it time. Especially if you are a small company with a limited team it can be daunting at the start but once you get rolling there are benefits and additional uses at every corner. It will take some time to get users on your side since it requires some lockdowns of Excel that not everyone is comfortable with, but they see how powerful the system can be and how much work it saves, they'll get it.

name: Michael R.
title: Director Finance
answers: Data consolidation is seamless; scripts translate currency automatically; standardized budget templates minimize monthly maintenance.
Report writer is not available and quick access Pivot Table through OLEDB connection is slow to the point it's virtually non-functional.

Our problems:  Massive Excel models interconnected with vlookup & sumif functions;  multiple versions of models to support Business Units made monthly maintenance a full-time job; forecasting in local foreign market currencies and introducing currency translation to existing models was not possible.

Vena's Solution:  Instantaneous consolidation of budget data; standardized budget templates eliminate costly hours of model maintenance; scripts perform currency translation behind the scenes so data is always available in USD or local currencies.

Vena leverages O-LAP cube technology and takes Excel based financial modeling to the next level, by eliminating Excel's pain-points and exploiting its strengths.  The implementation was well planned and executed flawlessly.  Also, the roll-out to budget owners was as simple and straight forward as it gets, and the benefits are literally realized overnight after implementation.

name: Carrie S.
title: Excel and a database
answers:
Vena is an amazing product with a great team behind it!  Some of the things I like best:
- Super easy implementation - after a bit of training by our implementation team, we did a significant portion of the design work ourselves
- Excel user interface which is stable and quick
- Security features and workflow on the web which makes it accessible from anywhere
- Customer engaged development team that works to meet the needs and wants of it's user base - They're always listening and improving!
- If you can dream it up in Excel, you can implement and use it through Vena
- Can be used for any kind of process - even beyond budgeting/planning/reporting, etc.
- Powerful and quick cloud database system - it never takes more than a few seconds to run anything
- If you have an Excel MVP on your team, you can make Vena do just about anything without having to engage their services team
- The interface is easy for even the least technically savvy user

All products can be improved... Some of the things I like least about Vena:
- Support is only through email and can sometimes take several hours to get a meaningful response (more than "I've received your request and I'm looking into it")
- The constant improvement of the product is awesome, but sometimes my users question why their add-in asks to update so often.  
- Set up and design takes a lot of clicking

When we started down the research path, we were really just trying to get a good budgeting product that would make the cycle shorter - but after we implemented, we realized it could be great for reporting as well.  Now our budgeting and reporting come from one source which makes life so much easier!  We shortened our budgeting cycle from 4-6 weeks for a first pass to about 10 days. In addition, we're spending more time on making inputs better rather than just trying to have the various inputs tie to each other.  We've also been able to more easily engage more people in the process.

We've seen several other processes that we could move to Vena (Development life-cycle, incident reporting, Asset planning, operational reporting, etc.) and while we haven't actually designed those processes yet, it's really great to know we have a product that could easily handle everything in one place rather than having to pay for multiple products. Powerful, flexible solution for budgeting, reporting, and anything else with
Know your processes and wish list before you start implementation to get the most out of the tool.  Consider what else you might use it for and how that might impact your design.

name: devon m.
title: Data Warehouse
answers: This is by far the most elegant (ie, powerful yet simple) integration of excel and a dimensional database I've yet used.  The relative ease (ie, speed) with which you can develop your current excel-based models into enterprise-class applications probably has to be experienced to be believed.  This product brought the terms self-service business intelligence, analytics, and data warehouse down from the domain of large-scale waterfall projects (hundreds of thousands of dollars) to an agile and practical reality for tens of thousands of dollars.

Honestly, very little.  Further, most minor annoyances have been addressed during the period of our ownership.  The current rate of development of the cloud-based application is very impressive.  Significant releases of new or improved functionality almost monthly.  It is likely beyond the scope of this review, and far beyond the interest of most users/readers here, but my most technical criticism would be directed at the maturity of the user interface for server side scripting - ie, the ability to do calculations "on the database side" rather than in excel.  The tools exposed to the user for evaluating errors in advanced VenaCalc scripts are not as robust as you might expect from other programming tools.

We were looking for a solution to increase the reliability (data integrity, audit trail, etc) and efficiency (aggregation / roll-ups, roll-over, etc)  of the income tax provision process for our $3 Billion multi-national with over 150 entities aggregating into several different federal consolidations and annual reports.  We dedicated one tax professional, not IT professional, and self-implemented a working proof-of-concept within a couple of weeks and all core functionality in less 8 weeks.  We were able to extend that functionality to all of the information that flows through our income tax cycle (including returns, estimates, etc) in the first year of ownership, and are piloting processes in other areas of finance.  For the income tax provision alone, roll-over went from several weeks to a couple of days.  Perhaps more importantly, we have eliminated the mystical -- no more "glitches" or otherwise unexplained changes.  The audit trail allows us to identify the source of all issues and correct them. Vena for Tax

It is important to understand that Vena is predicated on the idea that Excel is the front-end tool that finance professionals prefer to use.  If you want to continue to be able to leverage the full power of native excel but need enterprise-class data reliability and efficiency, I would strongly recommend this product.  If  you are not seeking to retain any part of your existing Excel-based workflow, then Vena is not as easy to recommend.  For example, if you are looking for a "pre-built" solution that has considered all the necessary business logic of your given problem, with a stock suite of forms and reports that are more comprehensive than your existing Excel-based analyses (ie, you want to throw out everything you have and start over), then Vena may not be the right solution.

name: Verified User in Non-Profit Organization Management
title: Growing Excel
answers: With Vena you’re working within an excel document but in an automated system.  It provides workflow automation, eliminates the worries around version control and serves as 1 robust source system of information.  Thanks to this automation, this has freed up a significant amount of time for myself to focus on strategic analysis and planning.  The time we otherwise would have spent aggregating data, reconciling sources and formatting spreadsheets, now is time better spent on really drilling down into performance and actually applying our findings in the field. Vena offered a flexible environment where we can make these changes on the fly, they’re easy to implement, and are virtually seamless for the end-user.
My only dislike of the system is that you will need to be a power excel user if you want to be self sufficient when creating your own custom reports.

This tool has also allowed us to enhance the level of information we’re able to provide to our users as part of the budget process.  It used to be very difficult and time consuming to incorporate benchmarking data into each individual budget template. Now, with some simple mapping, we’re able to provide prior year budget, year-to-date actuals and projected year end information to our budget managers which has been critical for benchmarking purposes and has really helped curb expense growth year over year by grounding us in the actual data.

The system has also allowed us to adhere to our annual strategic planning efforts by allowing us to cap growth in certain areas while simultaneously giving other departments the freedom to invest in approved strategic areas.  Before Vena, divisions were able to submit a budget where essentially the sky was the limit so it became a very tedious and time consuming process to bring all divisions back down to where they needed to be in order to balance the budget.  So with the help of the system’s built in controls we able to have a much more efficient and focused budget cycle, in a much shorter period of time.

name: Herman L.
title: Truly agile and adaptive as its name
answers:
One of the most impressive aspects of Workday Adaptive Planning is its agility, which allows organizations to quickly and easily adapt to changes in the business environment. 

For example, during corporate restructuring, business expansions, acquisitions, and mergers, we found that updating the modeling was painless. It's easy to modify the hierarchy of entities, add new dimensions for sales regions, and even rebuild the models to meet new requirements due to acquisitions. 

Workday Adaptive Planning's flexibility and real-time data capabilities made the process smooth and efficient. Overall, its agility is a key strength of the software that helps organizations make data-driven decisions with confidence.

The learning resources for the software need improvement. Currently, the learning materials do not provide sufficient support for users to apply best practices and fully leverage the software's capabilities.

We have found that some users have set up their instances in an ineffective way and struggle to use certain features, such as the multiple dimensional modeling. This is where more detailed and practical tutorials, as well as interactive training materials, can help users to understand the software's advanced features and functionalities.

Workday Adaptive Planning helps organizations to improve the budgeting and forecast planning processes, make more accurate and data-driven decisions, and achieve better business outcomes. These benefits include improved efficiency, real-time access to data and insights, enhanced collaboration, and advanced analytics capabilities.

name: Brittany P.
title: Workday is very quick, efficient , and accurate for account clerks
answers: From an account clerk perspective, workday has been a really great improvement for our government financial institution. It has made our jobs much faster and also much more accurate and transparent. We came from an older processing system, so the ability to copy supplier invoices and journals has made our job much more efficient. Also in terms of basic reporting, being able to export reports and findings via pdf and excel has also really been helpful. The drill in and search capabilities of workday have also been really good and have help zone into specific details or issues we were having. There was a small learning curve when we first switched, but once you master the capabilities, it becomes a great tool for success!

One thing that has been a struggle for our institution is reporting. We have had a very hard time with the format of the information we use being pulled and exported the same way. We are in the process of developing more reports, but so far reporting for state audits has been our biggest issue.

Workday is benefiting us, by making our jobs much more efficient. We are able to have all the tools needed for our fiscal department and the departments we keep financial records for. Workday gives everyone the same ability to look, and pull the information needed really efficiently.

This is a big miss, in my opinion. Also, maintenance can be cumbersome if significant changes are made frequently to how your organization is structured financially. Even if you have a direct integration with NetSuite, integrations easily fail and sometimes requires daily TLC to ensure that flow of actuals is smooth. Also, unfortunately the easiest way to upload budgets back into NetSuite is via manual upload file (which often fails if not everything matches 1:1).
Version control, single source of truth Best

name: Verified User in Utilities
title: Non-Functional
answers: I like the user interface.  It is clean.  Unfortunately, our implementation went extremely poorly so it is virtually unusable and I can't comment on the other features.

I dislike Adaptive's/Workday's business model because it incentives customer neglect.  During our evaluation process Adaptive seemed to have an excellent product and it was reasonably priced.  During this process we explained to the sales person that we had a very tight implementation goal and he reassured us several times that it would be challenging but we could make it.  The problem is that as soon as the licensing agreement was signed they passed us off to an implementation consultant (Revelwood), and it was up to Revelwood to deliver on all the promises Adaptive made.

Revelwood confirmed that the timeline was going to be tight but said they could do it.  We agreed to a very minimal feature implementation in order to achieve the go live.  However, Revelwood repeatedly missed deadlines, had extremely poor communication, and did a terrible job of project management.   

Afer missing a couple deadlines I complained to Adaptive and they raised the issue with Revelwood who responded by changing project managers.  The new project manager seemed like he was going to be great and I was hopeful everything would get back on track.  However, first impressions were misleading and we had all the same issues.  At one point our goal was to go live by Thanksgiving (our original go live was mid-June) and I told them that if there was any reason we would not be able to hit that goal I wanted to be notified as far in advance as possible and not to find out a day or two before we failed to go live.  Instead of giving me advance warning that we would miss the deadline, or even last minute notice, they simply told me nothing.  Thanksgiving came and went and they were completely silent.

Unfortunately, it got so late in the year we had to put the project on hold so we could do our annual budgeting process, still in Excel instead of Adaptive as we had expected.  Revelwood's repeated excuse was that our timeline for implementation was too aggressive.  However, by the time we put the project on hold it was past the duration they said was typical for a full implementation and we were doing an extremely minimal implementation.  So their excuse doesn't hold water.

It has been over a year since we signed the original subscription agreement and we still do not have a functional system.  Since we have not been using the system a client success manager from Adaptive reached out to us to see what they could do.  Unfortunately, do to competing priorities we will not be able to restart the implementation for several months.  This means we will have paid for 2 years of service and gotten absolutely no value out of it.  As such, I asked Adaptive if they could credit us for our first year of service and put a pause on our next invoice due shortly.  They said they couldn't do that.

This brings us back to their horrible business model (which I think is pretty common for large software packages like this).  During the sales process Adaptive is willing to promise the moon because they know they won't have to deliver on any of those promises.  They will pass the customer off to someone else and yet Adaptive still gets 3 years of subscription fees regardless of customer experience.  And Adaptive does not care enough about the long term relationship with the customer to be concerned about whether they are having a good experience.  They just want their 3 years of revenue.  This seems very short sighted on their part.

There are a lot of good FP&A systems out there and I regret choosing Adaptive.  We are currently considering going with a different FP&A system even though it means we will have a third year of wasted subscription fees.  Finding a true business partner may be worth the expense - that is how disappointing this experience has been.
Currently it is not solving any problems because it is not functional.  The implementation has gone terribly and Adaptive isn't doing enough to address the problems. Disappointing Implementation -

name: Verified User in Accounting
title: Workday ecosystem
answers: A good planning tool as a standalone. Allows for various customisation to support planning dimensions and scenarios. Inputs are straightforward, and allows users to go as detailed as they want, or as high level as they want.

Integration with Workday tenant still has much room for improvement. Whilst marketed as a whole ecosystem and the Power of One, a lot of dimensions that can be used in Adaptive cannot be sync-ed back into Workday due to the limitation on dimensions/worktags available on Workday Plan Template.

On Adaptive alone, performance can be a big issue especially when we run detailed and complex formulas to support our budget/forecasting requirements. On the report side, there are also known instances of lag in the flow down of information to the report side when changes to inputs have been made at the lowest input sheet level (ie. after a change in input at the sheet, some reports do not immediately reflect the changes). This proves extremely frustrating as the real-time visibility and budgeting abilities are lost.

The integration support within Adaptive can also be made more comprehensive. An example is the lag of ability within Adaptive to filter only distinct values for creation as dimensions or metadata in Adaptive. Workday side does not support Matrix reports for web services for integration, and on Adaptive side, no distinct vallues can be fitlered out. The double whammy on both WD and AI side results in a lot of manual intervention when we are looking to bring in distinct values. Overall, its still the integration with the whole Workday ecosystem that is limiting the use of Adaptive as a full fledge budgeting tool with the ability to consider the actuals in Workday.

Training on how to use the complex functions (Cube sheet and accounts etc.) can be made more comprehensive. Currently a lot of trial and error, and manual testing and reading of brief administrator guides are required to try and set up these complex functions.

Helping us as a forecasting tool. Ability to set assumptions, drive inputs from actual data in Workday (either via manual upload or integration) to drive forecasted numbers and estimate our performance for different time periods (quarter, year). Good as a standalone planning tool but not when integrated with

name: Becky F.
title: Great for medium to large businesses
answers: I like the option to have multiple working sheets available to all users. This allows for planning without affecting the organization's reforecast or budget, within each department, program area, and region. I also like that the Operating Expense sheet is spreadsheet based- with the ability to copy and paste from an oustide Excel sheet.

I don't like that our Personnel sheet only allows for annual changes. Not being able to input mid-year or quarterly changes affects our reforecasts and actuals. I also would like Personnel assumptions to be calculated automatically. For the price we pay and how robust the platform is, I feel that Adaptive should be able to pull the latest state and federal rates from known valid sources. This is definitely something that could be updated on the back end, and useful for users across all industries.

We're able to keep departmental/regional budgets accessible to users on the cloud, and not in a shared Excel sheet. This makes the budget managers more accountable for their projections and spendings.

We have a small organization, and will be leaving this platform at the end of our 3-year agreement. But if you're a medium or larger business, I would recommend this budgeting tool. The software can take on a very large capacity, allowing for larger businesses to really analyze each department- whether domestic or international. The data and access to analytics that are much more robust than what we need are also significant aspects for bigger firms. We're definitely aware that there are areas of the platform we're not using!

This has helped us tremendously in the years since our build to modify and build upon our instance.  If you did not do this, I could see issues for administrators.

It has give our users information at their fingertips and save our accounting department hours each month that we used to spend emailing reports.  Now users can log in and view what they need. Adaptive
it is a great tool to use.  Be sure to be involved in your implementation.

name: Margaret K. S.
title: Good product, its implementation is fast
answers: I love it's easy to customize for business requirements. Once the concept is known, it's easy to make modifications and create custom versions.
They constantly add new features and the priority map often seems out of line with customer requirements. For instance, prioritizing a color shift over improves protection.

It's a great app. The manner in which we prepare has changed completely. It can be fully adapted to your requirements. With the monitoring and user-friendly forecasting functions we have been able to obtain much more P&L from the operating department.
Build good relationships with your customer service as they can provide tremendous assistance. And premium support in the season.

name: Phillip  C.
title: Great product with huge potential
answers: Contrary to other reviews I find reporting and dashboards easy to use within the system once you've built a few. Being able to run different scenarios for outer year forecasts has been a huge benefit for our team. Any errors in the model are relatively easy to track down on your own, and the support team has been a huge asset to us throughout our time using Adaptive.

The entire user interface is really clunky, and could use a lot of investment. We have received a good amount of negative feedback on user experience from budget owners, but with time they get used to it. Data privacy rules within the system are overly rigid.

Long-term planning (3-year forecast currently) and Personnel planning have become much easier in Adaptive. Adding a year to your forecast can be as simple as clicking a button and checking assumptions if you've built your model well. Personnel planning as a live, collaborative process has also become much more manageable and accurate.

name: Miles M.
title: Flexibility
answers: Our users can now sign in and review their own expenses statements, purchases and client / customer data. To our clients and our limited accounting teams, this was a huge saver of time.

Initially, we wanted a consultant to help us develop. Our department chose to participate in the building to help our accounts and formulae better understand. Over the years since our construction, it has helped us tremendously to change and expand on our example. I could see problems for administrators if you haven't.
This gives our users data and saves our accounts hours per month that we used to e-mail documents. Users can now sign in and see what they need. Ease of Use, and
Cost-efficient and powerful solution for an increasingly complex healthcare firm. Make sure you engage in your implementation.

name: Verified User in Non-Profit Organization Management
title: Driver-Based Planning
answers: Having a single, unified source of truth available instantly anywhere has been a major boost to our organization's productivity. Given we have teams at dozens of locations utilizing the tool (who are also possess varying levels of financial fluency), Adaptive's easy-to-use nature has been a great asset to our FP&A team.

It would be great to have the option to build more fluid, complex models within the system. Adaptive's best and worst feature is that it essentially "operates like an Excel sheet in the cloud," allowing for easy standardization in a familiar layout--but at the cost of deeper customization.

With dozens of teams spread across multiple sites and time zones, the ability to have one location for all planning information has made our deliverable timelines much shorter, with better version control to boot. Adaptive neatly connects with most of our systems (Financial, Headcount and CRM), which means our FP&A team can spend more time doing analysis and less time worrying about data sourcing or template management. Adaptive's OfficeConnect tool means we can quickly run and iterate reporting as needed, which cuts down on reporting time overall. Adaptive Insights - Flexible,

Adaptive's strong integrations with NetSuite and Salesforce make it a great option if your organization already employs these systems. Adaptive has been a useful tool to standardize our forecast/budget processes due to its cloud-based nature, but understand that because of its simplified design, it lacks the deep functionality that other competitors may offer. However, the ease-of-use is a boon for looping in stakeholders who otherwise may not be fluent enough to successfully manage a more complex planning tool.

name: Nadia L.
title: A very agile budgeting and reporting app with seamless integration to NetSuite
answers:
It's amazing to see how much Adaptive has progressed over the years and I am excited to see what they have to offer in the future. They were a budgeting and reporting tool about 10 years ago with manual data load and now they're a fully integrated solution that provides intelligence to so many decision makers.
We can have multiple budget versions and get actuals from NetSuite updated on demand to compare to the plan and update the forecast.
We can run complex reports and create a standard reporting package, that will get updated straight in Excel with a few clicks of a button.
You can budget based on many financial and/or statistical drivers, the easy drag and drop, copy and paste interface makes it all super easy.

Setting up hierarchies takes a little time, it's not matched to NetSuite 1-1.
Pulling data from NetSuite from searches that return results over 1000 lines can be tricky and glitchy but I'm sure Adaptive will find a way to overcome this issue in the future releases.
Great decision support, budgeting and reporting as well as financial modelling solution.

Adaptive is a light but agile application that is not too costly compared to competitors. It integrates with NetSuite very well and is a great addition to an enterprise application portfolio in any industry.

name: Bailey C.
title: Adaptive Review
answers: Adaptive Insights is easy to navigate and is user friendly. Before the position I am currently in, I had zero experience with Adaptive. It is very easy to catch on and learn about. Adaptive Insights makes financial planning and forecasting much easier.

I dislike that you cannot filter for specific months when using the sheets. My company does a lot with "LTM" or "Last Twelve Months" time period. Not having the option to choose specific months makes this process a bit more time consuming than I would like.

Our monthly financials are uploaded each month using Adaptive. I have realized that Adaptive makes this process a lot faster for us. We are able to complete this entire process in about two hours rather than a full work day, which is about what it would take us without Adaptive. Adaptive also allows us to forecast our financials and implement budgets. We run all of our reports from Adaptive as well. I have realized that Adaptive has a lot of useful components.

name: Scott Z.
title: Implementation and a lifesaver in a rapidly growing organization
answers: Scale-able and was relatively easy to integrate. It's also nice having an ability to easily alter assumptions/hierarchies for various different scenarios

More education is needed on the initial set-up/design especially when linking to a multi-dimensional general ledger tool. Formulas are somewhat intuitive but can be complicated and I feel as though it should mirror Excel a little more.
Drastically reduced time spent in Excel and monitoring model integrity. Easily scale-able which has allowed our rapidly growing $80+M company to keep an entire FP&A function to 1 FTE Easy
Cost-effective and powerful solution for a rapidly growing complex health care company

name: Marvin G.
title: A high performing solution for increased business intelligence
answers: What I like the most about the product is that it is a solution in the cloud, with a modern engine for planning and analysis in memory, this technology makes the data always up-to-date and accurate, thus reducing budgeting times. Integrates multiple systems where financial information is stored improving the efficiency of the area and the flexibility of work resulting in the fast delivery of reports with a greater capacity of visualization.

Several years ago they had to recode the entire product so it wasn't java dependent. Before they did that it was extremely annoying every time your browser would update, features of Adaptive wouldn't work. Fortunately the resolved that problem. The experience from a user standpoint is very straight-forward but there is a bit of a learning curve as an administrator.

The simplicity is a super benefit. The user interface is very straight forward. We have looked at several competing products, even buying one of them only to moth-ball it, and Adaptive is every bit as powerful with a much more intuitive user experience. Keep your models simple as long as you don't go overboard in the beginning. This is not Excel which was difficult for people to wrap their heads around because it looks so similar at times.

Decide what level of investment you want to have on the administration side. There are other tools that may have broader capability but are significantly more complicated to manage and administer. We administer Adaptive within our finance organization with a non-IT headcount and it works great. You will not be able to plop in your current model to adaptive. Spend time redesigning your process to use what Adaptive has to offer.

name: Verified User in Media Production
title: Wish we didn't wait so long!
answers: Adaptive has allowed us to look at our business like never before.  The reporting flexibility is fantastic.  We have integrated our CRM which has given us a single source of information versus copying and pasting data from multiple sources.  It saves us significant amounts of time and allows us to analyze our buisness in meaningful ways we couldn't do before.
If we knew then what we know now.....I think we could have set up our instance in a more efficient way for the budgeters if we had a greater understanding of the program.

Adaptive has streamlined our budgeting process significantly which has freed up a lot of time of our key stakeholders to focus on running the business and driving growth.  We can easilty identify area's we are going over budget in order to course correct.

Invest in the set-up. Understand the system as much as possible in the initial stages in order to set up your sheets in the most efficient way.  Engage your users early on.  And be sure to invest in DISCOVERY.  It is fantastic and allows users to see data in very visually stimulating ways which engages them even more with the system.

name: Andrea F.
title: An invaluable tool!
answers: The workflow functionality and the ability to roll together multiple budgets with a click of a button!
Not much - we came from using spreadsheets for budgeting, so this tool has been a huge upgrade for us!

The ability for our high level budget mangers to look at multiple budgets across their division and give them the tools to make hard decisions - like reallocation's. Also, it has been a huge time saver for the budget office!  Adaptive Insights -
Do it! Especially if you are a Workday client. It was one of the best moves we ever made.

name: Louis F.
title: Able to handle complex organizations
answers: Adaptive serves as a single source of truth for our reporting, much better than passing around Excel books with different versions and changes and little to no audit trail. Adaptive allows you to create different versions, capture audit trail, and share reports in the web-based software or through their Excel plugin, OfficeConnect.

It is very complex and takes some getting used to. Our core finance team is finally getting comfortable with it (about 5 months in), but I'm not sure how things will go when we have to start doing the budget cycle in the spring and teach other business users how to find reports, etc in Adaptive.

With the integration with Intacct, pulling in actuals has been life-changing! We get actuals uploaded every night. The models that Adaptive allows you to build have also been helpful in reducing the number of Excel files we have to pass around. Slowly but surely, we are using Adaptive more and Excel less. Single-Source of Truth;
Consider getting a demo, going to a local event or even their Adaptive Live conference. Based on my research, Adaptive was well ahead most of the pack.

name: Matthew C.
title: Wonderful Product
answers: Adaptive is quite intuitive and easy to use. If you know Excel, then you can figure out Adaptive quite quickly. It has transformed our business unit by greatly reducing the amount of time it takes for us to turn around a forecast or reports, which has impacted our bottom line tremendously.
I would like to see some greater flexibility around non-specific time periods, for instance being able to use "Month 1, Month 2" etc. instead of MMMM/YYYY.

We update our 5-year forecast monthly, and Adaptive has allowed us to shorten the turn around period from days to hours, allowing us to spend more time analyzing the results instead of troubleshooting Excel. With more time, it allows for more scenario planning, quickly turning around cash flow forecasts in just minutes.
I would highly recommend this product -- spend the time and capital up front to ensure that the product is set up the way you like it. It has transformed our department.

It is not impossible to create these reports but very limited when you compare excel jet reports function. I believe it will continue to be improved. Other thing that I dislike is the formulas. We were thinking that we will be able to get rid of complex excel jet reporting formulas with Adaptive Insights. However, it seems like Adaptive Insights has its own coding (formula) language and it is not easier than other. Only working with a consultant can be a quick solution for that but you should consider to cost of it as well.
Defiantly revenue and OH budgeting process for our organization, I would recommend global organizations to use Adaptive Insights for budgeting.  Great for

We use Adaptive for our budgeting, forecasting, and internal reporting of financial metrics. It's super flexible and can be customized exactly to our business which makes all of the reports super relevant and valuable.  Great Reporting and

name: Verified User in Sports

Our headcount planning was very outdated and difficult to track in Excel but with Adaptive we can quickly and easily change headcount assumptions and see the impact to our financials. At a higher level, Adaptive has saved us many hours working on the budgeting and forecasting process. Adaptive
It is a great tool but it will be a time investment to learn how to use the system and how to set up financial models and sheets.

Easy to integrate with ERP such as SAP thanks to their API interface. Importing to Adaptive is smooth and easy to configure. Also when exporting to another application is needed, well suited interfaces can be built to fulfill any needs.

Not much to dislike here. I wish they included more basic data visualization with the basic package however.

Adaptive Insight's OfficeConnect product has been extremely useful and saved our team lots of valuable time updating slides during our month end business reviews. We highly recommend!
Version Control is another strength of Adaptive Insights. With the numerous versions we work it, Adaptive makes it extremely easy to collaborate especially during budget season.

We are able to blend multiple data sources providing consistent results.

We were able to better forecast for a large multi-affiliate company. I really appreciated that Adaptive Insights made forecasting so easy. I liked that we could have every department contribute to the forecast and have it all roll into one easy to read report.

I recommend Adaptive Insights as it's good for forecasting based on revenue and expenditure. You can easily customize and the options to import and export is pretty easy. You can easily export to Microsoft Excel.

The ability to analyze our data to make decisions quicker has been a huge benefit.

This software is easy to use once you've been trained, but there is quite a lot in the software that I don't know intuitively how to use. You also can't tie different budget versions together, which is slightly annoting when I need to create a new budget and forecast.
The version control, multiple user access, and ability to run reports have all made collaborating on budgets across offices much easier.

It is a very good tool, but the interface could be a bit more user friendly.  Furthermore, Office Connect could also improve by allowing the analyst to open more than one report at once. It is very frustrating having to close a file, just to open a second one you need when comparing data and changes.

My company also utilizes a sw called Domo where we can easily visualize cards and dashboards. I would like to see a feature where we could easily export data from Adaptive into Domo and the cards could be automatically updated with the latest forecasts and scenarios.

name: Andrew S.
title: Powerful software for budget forecasting and advanced modeling, our single source of truth
answers: Excellent customer experience from the start.  My Sales Rep, Customer Success Managers, and even the Adaptive Insights finance team have been able to help me and set me up with the tools to succeed. I have been able to take my excel models which were becoming cumbersome and error prone and migrate them  into a streamlined relational database. Implementing Adaptive has allowed my to drive change across the business and bring our departments together.

Office Connect will not work on Macs which is what most of my company uses. Steep learning curve with limited free training materials. Saving and loading sheets can be  slow sometimes.   Like most powerful software, users will only get out the effort they invest. Organizations unwilling to dedicate the time needed to set up the system structure and bring together key stakeholders will not gain the full value of Adaptive

One Issue included separate systems used by each departments that were not connected. Finance would have conflicting information with Sales and Support. Now our systems are integrated and we are reviewing the same data.
Another issue was maintenance of Excel models. Previously making changes was time consuming and error prone. Now we can have separate versions of plans to allow for quick changes
Make sure you are ready to commit the time and resources to make the implementation work. If you do you will be well rewarded.

name: Verified User in Non-Profit Organization Management
title: Planning and reporting
answers: Love the flexibility and most of all the office connect feature.  Also love the ability to roll it out to individual users so they can have input.   The drill through feature has also been very helpful.
Not much.  We are currently working with consultants to make functional and efficiency improvements but that is expected with any software.
Centralizing our reporting and analytics.  The flexibility of the input sheets and setting up accounts/attributes has really streamlined our reporting.   Review of Adaptive

name: Andrew B.
title: Insights with Adaptive
answers: Ease of use, regular updates, inferface is very intuitive. The application is very scaleable as our business has grown, and can deal with our international footprint well through FX reporting. The Excel Add-In is also a great touch as some users still prefer to edit data in this way.
Nothing - the product is regularly updated each year so there is always new functionality being added.

Collaboration around budgets and forecasting, assisting with reducing time taken for month end close (from plus 15 days using old Excel models to now 1 - 2 days with Adaptive). The product also deals with reporting restructures well, as the level hierarchy in the model is very flexible and can be tagged with many different dimensions and attributes. What-if scenario planning is also very easy as budget versions can be instantly copied and modified to show the impact of flexing certain model variables. Constant currency reporting is also available, or being able to show the data with any set of FX rates (ie - what if prior year actuals were restated at current year budget rates etc).

Go for it. Adaptive is a great product, you just need to make sure you have clearly documented how your current model is working and built up before you start the implementation process. That said, it is still very easy to modify things to add new functionality beyond the initial implementation.

name: Michael S.
title: Great service, even greater potential
answers: The tool itself is very quick with updating and there are many features that allow you to check your work along the way (sheets, formula validation, etc.) I also like the ability to version control,; by creating new versions during crucial parts of the budget process, it allows us to reference prior submissions and be more smart about finding variances between what we are submitting and what we submitted.

The planning tools are poor and are difficult to effectively utilize without the ability to upload data. Planning also seems very counter-productive in Adaptive since it requires you to view the income statement of the smallest department in every single hierarchy. By requiring that, it essentially precludes the user from doing a top-down forecasting approach, which a lot of start-up companies end up doing. Additionally, Office Connect has an abysmal time integrating with Excel, and often slows down or crashes the program entirely. I think it would behoove Adaptive to try and emulate what Hyperion is doing with their Microsoft Excel add-in.

- Automated reporting
 - Department heads are inputting their own budgets
 - Accountability across departments
 - Quick and easy month close variance analysis

Enhance OfficeConnect:
One of the worst parts about Adaptive is the integration between Adaptive and Excel. Since most companies operate primarily within Excel, it is difficult to get many tasks done seamlessly without having some manual intervention between exporting out of Adaptive and into Excel.

name: Verified User in Philanthropy
title: And Resources
answers:
The flexibility offered by this product is amazing, it allows you to build a model that suits your business needs. Regardless of HOW you do business, Adaptive supports this as you create your own structure, custom accounts, and cost drivers, and  then consolidate the data to reports and dashboards,

Implementing Adaptive for our budgeting was a game changer, it put the data in the hands of the budget owners. As budgets changed throughout the iterative process, we knew that we were always looking at the most up-to-date version by running a single report - no more manual reconciliations / updates.

Because the software is so flexible, you have to be very careful when creating formulas and building reports that you are capturing all of the information. While it is easy to segment a particular set of data, it is also easy to leave that out if you do not understand the structure and connections within the various moving pieces. Take the time to plan your organization and account structure, and really take the time to understand it, and you will be fine.

We have gained major efficiencies in our annual budget process - cutting down time spent consolidating budgets or getting the data in to the right format for different stakeholders. This allows our Finance team to spend more time on analysis and strategy than data entry. In addition, with the ability to have different versions, we have moved to a more frequent forecasting schedule, which allows us to keep a better eye on how we are tracking and manage risk.  Fantastic Product And Vendor Support, But Invest The Time

If you can, meet some customers in your industry who use Adaptive already. Now, we are in contact with another organization who went live before we did, and we have helped each other to build tools and reports and address challenges that apply to both companies. It would have been great to learn about some of the challenges up front and how we could have addressed some of the shortcomings of our other software, or with a change to our configuration before implementing. And again, take the time to first review your financial planning and reporting processes and figure out how you can improve them using the new system, rather than trying to fit Adaptive to your "current state".

-Adaptive Planning is easily accessible as it is web browser based, therefore can be accessed anywhere in the world.
-A single tool which can be used for company wide budgeting, and can be catered for each company no matter how complex or simple the business model.
- Unlike Excel, multiple users can be budgeting and making changes at the same time.
